intro: Orthocarpus rubicundulus, commonly known as the red-veined orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, with a glossy surface. Orthocarpus rubicundulus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
